intro: Pseudognaphalium ehrenbergianum, commonly known as the Mexican everlasting or blue everlasting, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant produces small, blue to purple flowers that are tightly packed in compact, spherical clusters. It is a perennial herb that thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in dry, rocky habitats. Its foliage is typically gray-green with a woolly texture, contributing to its drought tolerance and ornamental appeal.
